reviews.review_msg: She is so nice! Highly recommend her guys!
Best prof.
best prof
Best prof ever.

Like most language classes, there was attendance taken and lots of homework + projects (not that it was hard, just tedious). Its an easy course to B in, but hard enough so she doesn't hand out a lot of As. Jia is very specific on what an "A" is, but she says in person doesn't always match what's on canvas. Be aware, she'll still take marks off.
She's really nice, lectures are super active and very interesting, definitely recommend this prof! (And it's a good gpa booster too)
I, without any hesitation, hold back, or reservation,  recommend taking any class that this professor holds.  She is a professor's Professor.  Laoshi Jia Fei rocks!  PS  Jia is a great credit to SFU!
Chin 101 is SO MUCH HARDER than chin 100. She's very picky about the little things. Other than that, nice prof.

Every day I look forward to Jia Fei's classes! She shows that she genuinely cares about her students and even does things like tell a little story about every Chinese character to help you memorize them. She has a good sense of humour and CHIN100 with her was an easy A+!!  In addition to learning a ton, I got a great grade and had fun!!
She is very kind, helpful and fair. Weekly quizzes are easy as long as you memorized the vocabs. Midterm is an open topic. If you are taking chinese 152, take with her!
She is a awesome teacher and lecturer, I would say she really cares about student. She is reeally couraging and I can see her as a very nice and warmhearted young lady.
She is such a great teacher! Her class will help any beginner. There are weekly quizes which are a spelling test and grammar test which are fair game. She is always available to help you understand.
1 word: Awesome

Awesome professor! Has an EXCELLENT ear, she can clearly find out who is fluent in Mandarin and kicked 1/4 of the people who thought they were so smug that they got into the class. She takes her time to help students with pronunciation. Really nice too!

Ms. Jia Fei is a sweetie - extremely helpful, approachable, and friendly. She teaches quite well. The workload is more than fair (though there is a quiz practically every class). Not a fast paced class - suitable for beginners. The textbook is simple and straight forward. A bit of practice and review of textbook will yield an enjoyable experience!

Nice teacher with awesome personality! Extremely helful when it comes to answering questions. Enjoy the small fun class atmosphere. Material tends to be somewhat repititive sometimes. A time-consuming course but an excellent GPA booster!
This class made me want to continue studying chinese!

Fairly easy, quite strict marker on quizzes. Oral presentation/exam was fairly marked. Final wasn't too hard if you study the textbook. This prof gives a lot of assignments. 1 textbook 1 workbook every week for 10% of the course. 10% participation,  10% quizzes (7 in total), 20% oral presen, 20% oral exam, and 30% Final exam.

If you know some Mandarin before taking this course, it shouldn't be a hard course. Workload is very heavy for a 3 credit course, the work (mostly prepare orals, excercise, or dictations) is time-consuming but it does not kill braincells. Very easy to get C+ or above, impossible to get higher than A-. She is a great prof for this course.
good course & great learning atmosphere, this course can improve your mandarin speaking skill.
It is quite a easy course eventhough i am a pure CBC. it is a GPA booster course . ;)
very nice teacher. wonderful finals. weekly exams. not overly picky. she's as easy as you can get for this course

This class is pretty easy if u can speak a little mandarin. However there is a fair amount of work to be done: quiz and assignment each week. However u don't really have to know how to write mush chinese (speaking is the main point here). The exam is a 15 min "talk" with the prof . This is not an easy class to bump up your grade.
No Comments

She is really great. She even helps you if you have trouble registering for the course. Also if you don't know how to say some mandarin, she is willing to stay behind and help you after class. She is really nice, and she will make sure you know how to say one word before going on to another. Small class size.
